sen.e: Aikyu is a term meaning a form of territory in the early-modern times when the murauke system (a system of village-wide, collective responsibility for tax payment) was established.

sen.j: 公家や寺社、諸藩の家臣の所領にも存在するが、最も代表的なのは江戸幕府が旗本の支配を確実にする事と彼らの江戸居住（地方在勤者を除く）を義務付けたために、小禄旗本の知行地（知行所）が集中した関東地方に多く見られる。
sen.e: Although also found in territories of court nobles, temples and shrines, and vassals of domains, aikyu is most typically found in Kanto region where chigyo-chi (territories) of hatamoto (direct retainers of the bakufu, which is a form of Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) with small stipend (fiefdoms) were concentrated because the Edo bakufu required hatamoto to live in Edo (except those who worked in provinces) in order to ensure control of them.

sen.j: 領主の種類は旗本には限定されず、諸大名、諸寺社、幕府領、そして旗本領などで構成された。
sen.e: Types of feudal lords were not limited to hatamoto, but included territorial lords, temples and shrines, shogunal demesnes, and hatamoto demesnes.
Aikyu was not only the ownership form for not only hatamoto but also territorial lords, temples and shrines, and the shogunal demesnes and hatamoto demesnes were also included in it.

sen.e: Aikyu was the form of ownership used for not only the territory of hatamoto, but also that of territorial lords, temples and shrines, and the bakufu.

sen.j: 記録によると13人の領主が割り当てられた十三給という村落も存在した（なお、岡山藩領の邑久郡尾張村（現在の岡山県瀬戸内市）では享保年間に26人の領主に分割されていたとする記録がある）。
sen.e: According to records, there was even a village of zyusan (13)-kyu to which 13 feudal lords were assigned (it is also recorded that Owari village of Oku County [present-day Setouchi City, Okayama Prefecture], which was owned by Okayama Domain, was shared by 26 feudal lords in the Kyoho era.)

It is recorded that there were some villages whose territorial form was jusan (13)-kyu with the assignment of 13 feudal lords (even there is a record that a village called Owari-mura located in Oku County [present Setouchi City, Okayama Prefecture], a territory of Okayama Domain, was shared by as many as 26 lords during the Kyoho era).

sen.j: この制度導入の背景には土地の良し悪しや年貢率による実収とのバランス、旗本による知行権行使の抑制、小禄知行取の存在、村を分断して農民たちの団結を防ぐなどが言われている。
sen.e: This system is believed to have been introduced for purposes such as balancing real income based on fertility of land and land tax rate, inhibiting hatamoto from exercising their right to manage field, and preventing villagers from uniting by splitting a village, and due to reasons such as presence of small stipendiary chigyo-tori (recipients of land revenue).

This system is believed to have been introduced for such reasons as securing a well-balanced real income in proportion to the fertility of land and tax rate, inhibiting hatamoto from exercising their right to chigyo-chi, and preventing villagers from uniting by dividing the village with the presence of several small-stipendiary chigyo-tori (recipients of land revenue).

sen.e: This system is believed to have been introduced for such reasons as securing a well-balanced real income in proportion to the fertility of land and tax rate, inhibiting hatamoto from exercising their right to chigyo-chi, and preventing villagers from uniting by dividing the village with the presence of several small-stipendiary chigyo-tori (recipients of land revenue).

sen.j: もっともこれが却って旗本の知行地支配の不安定を招いて旗本の窮乏化、ひいては旗本の軍事力に支えられた江戸幕府の衰微を促したとする説もある。
sen.e: However, some say that despite these intentions this system destabilized the control of chigyo-chi under hatamoto and impoverished them, thereby accelerating the decline of the Edo bakufu which had been supported by military power of hatamoto.

However, some scholars say that despite the bakufu's intentions, this system, which made hatamoto difficult to control their chigyo-chi in a stable manner, impoverished them and consequently it accelerated the decline of the Edo bakufu which was sustained by the military power of hatamoto.

sen.e: Feudal lords organized "go gonin-gumi" based on the area of residence in addition to gonin-gumi system which was established based on feudal lords' chigyo (enfeoffment), which also added confusion to the already muddled village politics.

sen.e: In addition to the gonin-gumi unit established based on each feudal lord's chigyo (enfeoffment), other units such as community-level "go gonin-gumi" (community mutual surveillance unit) were formed, and such a pluralism of the mutual surveillance complicated the village political situations.
